```{r}
#all the 2022 stats, wins v PA
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)

# Helper function to compute r and r2 label
make_r_label <- function(x, y) {
  r <- cor(x, y)
  r2 <- r^2
  paste0("r = ", round(r, 3),
         "\nr² = ", round(r2, 3))
}

### 1. Wins vs Points Allowed (PA)
ggplot(X2022WITHWINS, aes(x = Wins, y = PA, label = Tm)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  geom_text_repel(size = 3) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = "green", se = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Wins", y = "Points Allowed", title = "NFL 2022 Wins vs Points Allowed") +
  annotate("text",
           x = max(X2022WITHWINS$Wins),
           y = min(X2022WITHWINS$PA),
           label = make_r_label(X2022WITHWINS$Wins, X2022WITHWINS$PA),
           hjust = 1, vjust = 0) +
  theme_minimal()

  labs(x = "Wins", y = "Rushing Yards Per Game", title = "NFL 2022 Wins vs Rushing Yards Per Game") +
```

```{r}
#For 2019 stats 
library(broom)
library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
# Change the path for each year (2019, 2022, 2023, 2024)
nfl_2019 <- read_excel("nfl_2019.xlsx")

# If Wins are stored in W column:
nfl_2019 <- nfl_2019 %>%
  mutate(Wins = W)

# ---- MULTIPLE LINEAR REGRESSION ----
# Predicting Wins using all 6 stats
model_2019 <- lm(
  Wins ~ PassYds_pg + RushYds_pg + Pts_pg +
    PassYdsAllowed_pg + RushYdsAllowed_pg + PtsAllowed_pg,
  data = nfl_2019
)
# Regression summary (coefficients, p-values, R-squared, etc.)
summary(model_2019)

# Nice tidy table (useful for report)
tidy(model_2019)
glance(model_2019)  # overall fit (R-squared, etc.)

```

```{### --- Load Packages ---}

library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

### --- Load Data ---
df <- read_excel("ALLSTATS2024.xlsx")

### --- Wins column ---
wins <- df$W   # adjust if your wins column has a different name

##################################################################
# 1. Pts
##################################################################

stat <- df$Pts
r_value <- cor(wins, stat, use = "complete.obs")
r_sq <- r_value^2

cat("\nWins vs Pts\n")
cat("r =", round(r_value, 4), "\n")
cat("r^2 =", round(r_sq, 4), "\n")

ggplot(df, aes(x = W, y = Pts)) +

    y = "Points"
  ) +
```
